conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C, and D and needs to be predicted whether it flows into container E or F after passing through baffles.
Container A is located at the top left and has a green baffle below it.
Container B is located next to A and has a yellow baffle below it.
Container C is located next to B and has a blue baffle below it.
Container D is located next to C and has a light blue baffle below it.
Container E is located at the bottom left and has a white opening.
Container F is located at the bottom right and has a blue opening.
Liquid flows from A downward, encounters a green baffle that directs it horizontally to the right, then meets a vertical baffle that directs it downward into container E.
Liquid flows from B downward, encounters a yellow baffle that directs it horizontally to the right, then meets a vertical baffle that directs it downward into container F.
Liquid flows from C downward, encounters a blue baffle that directs it horizontally to the right, then meets a vertical baffle that directs it downward into container F.
Liquid flows from D downward, encounters a light blue baffle that directs it horizontally to the right, then meets a vertical baffle that directs it downward into container E.
Liquid from A and D flows into container E, while liquid from B and C flows into container F.
Final answer: A and D flow into container E, B and C flow into container F.
